snippet: To the 60 or so mourners who gathered in front of a chimpanzee’s Florida cage on Saturday, it didn’t matter whether he was the grinning sidekick of the “Tarzan” films.
abstract: Approximately 60 mourners gather at the Suncoast Primate Sanctuary in Palm Harbor, Florida, to memorialize beloved chimpanzee Cheetah; caregivers claim that Cheetah was 80-years-old, and that he was the the same chimp who acted alongside Johnny Weissmuller in the Tarzan movies of the 1930's, though primate experts say that claim is improbable at best.
lead_paragraph: To the 60 or so mourners who gathered in front of a chimpanzee’s Florida cage on Saturday, it didn’t matter whether he was the grinning sidekick of the “Tarzan” films.

headline.seo: Sanctuary Claims Recently Deceased Chimp Was in ‘Tarzan’
headline.main: A Farewell to Cheetah, the Original or Otherwise
headline.print_headline: Death of a Chimpanzee Revives Doubts About Its Film Résumé
